feedback.question: What features would you like to see in a digital banking service?
feedback.results: The responses overwhelmingly emphasize the importance of features that help with budgeting, specifically personalized budgeting tools that categorize spending and provide insights on saving money. Additionally, real-time notifications for transactions and balances are consistently mentioned as important. Goal setting and tracking features, including emergency funds, debt repayment, and savings for short-term and long-term goals, are also commonly requested along with investment recommendations and portfolio tracking based on members' risk tolerance. Mobile check deposit and a remote ATM locator feature are frequently mentioned as convenient as well. Finally, biometric login security and 24/7 customer service are essential for all respondents.

feedback.question: How often do you use mobile banking services?
What would make you switch to a different digital banking service?
feedback.results:
The responses indicate that a significant factor in swaying consumers to switch digital banking services is the availability of better or more advanced features, such as personalized financial insights and investment recommendations, better budgeting tools, more convenience, a more user-friendly user interface, and better security. Better customer service and handling fee structures/commission rates also contribute to the decision-making process. The survey results thus highlight that advanced analytics and security features are important factors along with a streamlined online mobile banking experience.
Only overwhelmingly strong data protection measures will give people growing confidence both individually alongside institutions using them for banking individuals money. Any lack in terms either ease and convenience or rigorous data protection may put many people off utilizing the app. Lastly, having effective customer service to respond,resolve&operate upon customer queries appears central!

feedback.question: How important is it for you to have frequent engagement with your credit union through their mobile app?
What concerns do you have about using a new digital banking service?
feedback.results: The main concern mentioned by participants when it comes to using a new digital banking service is the security of their personal and financial information, as well as the reliability of the service. Other common concerns include user-friendliness and ease of use, compatibility with other financial apps and tools, and transparent fees and charges. It seems that security and reliability are the most prevalent concerns across all responses. Participants also mention the importance of a user-friendly interface and good customer support.

feedback.question: On a scale of 1-10, how likely are you to sign up for our new digital banking service?
What could we do to make you more likely to sign up for our new digital banking service?
feedback.results: The majority of respondents suggested that offering a trial period or demo of the digital banking platform would make them more likely to sign up, as well as providing more information about security measures. Personalized recommendations based on spending habits and financial goals, transparency around fees and charges, and competitive interest rates were also emphasized as important factors. Additionally, many respondents suggested incentives such as promotional deals or waived fees, user-friendly interfaces, excellent customer service, and educational content on personal finance topics as ways to make them more likely to sign up. Overall, security, convenience, and personalized recommendations appear to be key factors in consumers' decision-making process.
